update.description:
Moved the globals diff utility functions and implementation from [__main.py__](#!/monashspinor/runmanager/src/7f3022829ce83e639a971966a29194431fc1a945/__main__.py?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#__main__.py-1916) into __init__.py (not optimal, but it's where dict_diff & other utilities are). Turned these into general purpose functions globals_diff_groups (which accepts two sets of globals groups) and globals_diff_shots (which accepts filenames). These can be used outside of the GUI, for example globals_diff.py,
which can be added to the (right-click) 'Send to' menu on Windows by copying a
shortcut to globals_diff.bat in shell:sendto.
update.title: Generalised globals diff implementation to permit command line comparison of two shot files

content.raw:
Hey Russ,

I pulled from MonashSpinor, backed out the sineramp_invert commit and pushed, so as to update this pull request to only include the globals diff changes, and so now it doesn't contain the sineramp_invert thing I'll merge.

Hey Russ,

I pulled from MonashSpinor, backed out the sineramp_invert commit and pushed, so as to update this pull request to only include the globals diff changes, and so now it doesn't contain the sineramp_invert thing I'll merge.

content.raw:
Putting any functionality in `__init__.py` that is supposed to be externally usable seems exactly right to me! So I see no problem with that, even though some of the implementation is exposed too.

It looks like you've accidentally added an extra commit - your idea is to call that function in runmanager gui-entered globals? Seems fine, but a) probably replace the exception with a `ValueError`, since `LabscriptError` is not imported, and so far is only used within labscript itself. and b). Is `if not (y <<)` a syntax error? Looks like one!
content.html:
Putting any functionality in __init__.py that is supposed to be externally usable seems exactly right to me! So I see no problem with that, even though some of the implementation is exposed too.

It looks like you've accidentally added an extra commit - your idea is to call that function in runmanager gui-entered globals? Seems fine, but a) probably replace the exception with a ValueError, since LabscriptError is not imported, and so far is only used within labscript itself. and b). Is if not (y <<) a syntax error? Looks like one!
